text.section:
A holder of a provisional driver's license who is under the age of 18 years is guilty of high-risk driving if the holder of the provisional license commits any of the following violations:
§ 21-901.1 of this subtitle (Reckless and negligent driving);
§ 21-901.2 of this subtitle (Aggressive driving); or
§ 21-1116 of this title (Race or speed contest prohibited).

section.section:
If the individual is convicted of a violation specified in subsection (a) of this section, the Administration shall suspend the individual's driver's license:
For a first offense, for 6 months; and
For a second or subsequent offense, for 1 year.
An individual subject to a license suspension under this subsection may request a hearing as provided for a suspension or revocation under Title 12, Subtitle 2 of this article.
